For some more background you might want  to visit the following bug report:  https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=338621  --> <?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="/WebResource.axd?d=OG6ICBS3XdykvyL_wBngEtwfPZ1xqVL3SJbFznhjfEgbO7QCYjHbDfgdgnO_5IYl31FcIeZ2u_qHqs8zCgU_y6DDpKxLyAV4MxNJVxfxbqAA9wnJHfwytgbvEYfRnFp2CKySbJEfaqzaXNpSNK6oTGhGshY1&t=635319500310794128" media="screen"?> <feed xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns:content="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/content/" xmlns:media="http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/">   <title>Chemistry</title>   <subtitle>The School of Chemistry is one of the largest in the country and has a reputation for excellence in both teaching and research. We are ranked second in the country for research in chemistry (RAE 2008) and our undergraduate degrees offer high-quality teaching in a first-class learning environment.</subtitle>   <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/chemistry/chemistry.aspx?RelatedItemsasStandardList_SyndicationType=2" />   <generator>Contensis: http://www.contentmanagement.co.uk</generator>   <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/chemistry/chemistry.aspx?SyndicationType=2</id>   <updated>2015-03-06T08:53:58Z</updated>   <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/chemistry/chemistry.aspx?SyndicationType=2" rel="self" type="application/atom+xml" />   <entry>     <title>Chemistry BSc</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/chemistry/bsc-chemistry.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>The MSci and BSc degrees provide an in-depth study of all of the major branches of chemistry, and a comprehensive grounding in modern, practical synthetic and analytical chemistry. Study within these core areas is enhanced by a wide range of special topics, many of which draw from the exciting research of staff within the School.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:56:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-11-25T08:17:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/chemistry/bsc-chemistry.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Chemistry with a Year in Industry MSci</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/chemistry/chemistry-year-industry.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>This four-year course provides the broad, in-depth chemistry training of the MSci Chemistry course, with the added dimension of an assessed year spent in a research laboratory of a major chemical company. The strong and broad foundation in all areas of chemistry provided by the first two years provide an excellent base from which you can successfully experience research work in a prestigious industrial laboratory.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:06:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-01-06T17:04:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/chemistry/chemistry-year-industry.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Chemistry MSci</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/chemistry/msci-chemistry.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>The MSci and BSc degrees provide an in-depth study of all of the major branches of chemistry, and a comprehensive grounding in modern, practical synthetic and analytical chemistry. Study within these core areas is enhanced by a wide range of special topics, many of which draw from the exciting research of staff within the School.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:07:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-11-26T09:55:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/chemistry/msci-chemistry.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Medicinal and Biological Chemistry BSc</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/chemistry/bsc-medicinal-biological-chemistry.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>The MSci/BSc Medicinal and Biological Chemistry courses combine comprehensive training in all aspects of chemistry with in-depth training in the key aspects of biochemistry, pharmacy, pharmacology, physiology and microbiology relevant to understanding human disease and drug design.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:07:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-11-26T10:28:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/chemistry/bsc-medicinal-biological-chemistry.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Chemistry with an International Study Year MSci</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/chemistry/chemistry-international-study.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>The MSci and BSc degrees provide an in-depth study of all of the major branches of chemistry, and a comprehensive grounding in modern, practical synthetic and analytical chemistry. Study within these core areas is enhanced by a wide range of special topics, many of which draw from the exciting research of staff within the School.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:06:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-11-26T09:33:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/chemistry/chemistry-international-study.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Medicinal and Biological Chemistry MSci</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/chemistry/msci-medicinal-biological-chemistry.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>The MSci/BSc Medicinal and Biological Chemistry courses combine comprehensive training in all aspects of chemistry with in-depth training in the key aspects of biochemistry, pharmacy, pharmacology, physiology and microbiology relevant to understanding human disease and drug design.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:07:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-11-26T10:50:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/chemistry/msci-medicinal-biological-chemistry.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Medicinal and Biological Chemistry with an Assessed Year in Industry MSci</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/chemistry/medicinal-biological-chemistry-year-industry.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>The MSci/BSc Medicinal and Biological Chemistry courses combine comprehensive training in all aspects of chemistry with in-depth training in the key aspects of biochemistry, pharmacy, pharmacology, physiology and microbiology relevant to understanding human disease and drug design.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:06:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-11-26T10:52:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/chemistry/medicinal-biological-chemistry-year-industry.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Chemistry and Molecular Physics BSc</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/chemistry/bsc-chemistry-molecular-physics.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Paul Gelsthorpe</name>     </author>     <summary>The BSc and MSci Chemistry and Molecular Physics (CMP) courses are three- or four-year single honours degrees which focus on the area of overlap between the traditional disciplines of chemistry and physics. The course emphasises molecular and solid-state physics, quantum mechanics and spectroscopy, and the more quantitative aspects of chemistry.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:07:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-08-05T15:42:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/chemistry/bsc-chemistry-molecular-physics.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Chemistry and Molecular Physics MSci</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/chemistry/msci-chemistry-molecular-physics.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Paul Gelsthorpe</name>     </author>     <summary>The BSc and MSci Chemistry and Molecular Physics (CMP) courses are three- or four-year single honours degrees which focus on the area of overlap between the traditional disciplines of chemistry and physics. The course emphasises molecular and solid-state physics, quantum mechanics and spectroscopy, and the more quantitative aspects of chemistry.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:07:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-08-05T15:48:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/chemistry/msci-chemistry-molecular-physics.aspx</id>   </entry> </feed>
